definition: lit. honing a bull's horn; fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs/same as idiom 鑽牛角尖|钻牛角尖
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs

sentences.english: Advice is not for the knowledge of knowledge, into a dead end.
sentences.chinese: 建議就是不要爲了知識而知識，鑽牛角尖。

sentences.english: Don't be too single-minded. It will only serve to bind you later on.
sentences.chinese: 別太鑽牛角尖，這隻會成爲你日後的羈絆。

sentences.english: Ongoing from that was a phase of a propensity for depression, for compulsion, for paranoia.
sentences.chinese: 那的確是一段抑鬱，容易偏執鑽牛角尖的日子。

sentences.english: The fact that you want to do better with your time means you’re stuck as-is.
sentences.chinese: 事實上你想做得更好意味着你已被卡住，鑽牛角尖了。

sentences.english: Does not overanalyze negative points, but instead looks for the positive points in the subject being analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 不會鑽牛角尖過度悲觀，能看到事物積極的一面。
